text: These are people who certainly have not proved that they are worthy of the trust that we repose in them. As far as this job is concerned, let me also indicate that when it comes to BECE, most of the decisions are taken by the Ghana Education Service. For example, the selection of supervisors and invigilators is done by the district exams officer, he explained. His comments come in the wake of a JoyNews Hotline investigation led by GH Probe’s Francisca Enchil, which uncovered disturbing levels of collusion at examination centres.

text: A variety of socioeconomic and cultural factors were identified as major barriers to accessing and utilizing MHCS. Over half of the women surveyed cited poverty, illiteracy, restrictions from their husbands, the distance to health facilities, and long queues as reasons for not using services. Additionally, over a third of the women pointed to cultural practices within their communities as a cause for delays in seeking care. These findings reveal that addressing maternal health in this region requires more than just improving clinical services; it also means tackling deeply rooted societal and personal challenges that women face daily.
translated: [Kiambuadi kwa kipengele cha kiuchumi na kitamaduni kilichogunduliwa kama vikwazo vikuu vya kupata na kutumia MHCS. Zaidi ya nusu ya wanawake waliojibu majaribio walisema umaskini, ujuzi usio na elimu, vikwazo kutoka kwa waume wao, umbali wa kituo cha afya, na mizunguko ndefu kama sababu za kutotumia huduma. Zaidi ya hayo, zaidi ya theluthi moja ya wanawake walisema mazoea ya kitamaduni ndani ya jamii zao kama sababu ya kuchelewa kutafuta huduma. Matokeo haya yanaonyesha kwamba kushughulikia afya ya uzazi katika eneo hili kunahitaji zaidi ya kuboresha huduma za kimatibabu; pia inamaanisha kushughulikia changamoto za kijamii na za kibinafsi ambazo wanawake hukabiliana nazo kila siku.]

text: Despite his shortcomings, Unoka was a talented musician. He was a tall but very thin man with a slight stoop and a mournful look, which would disappear when he was drinking or playing his flute. His happiest moments came in the months after the harvest, when the village musicians would retrieve their instruments from above the fireplace. Unoka would join them, his face filled with pure joy and peace. Sometimes, other villages would invite Unoka and his band to teach them their tunes, and they would stay for several months, sharing their music.

text: At the Derby Avenue RC Basic School and St. George’s Anglican Basic School in Accra, invigilators were captured openly demanding GH¢60 daily tokens, supervisors pocketed envelopes of GH¢400, and candidates were asked to contribute to an Aseda Offertory. John Kapi stressed that once WAEC provides feedback on such incidents, it is the responsibility of the Ghana Education Service (GES) to take decisive action. And so when these issues come up, once the feedback goes to them, we [WAEC] expect that they would react appropriately and ensure that the right action is taken against the people, he said.
translated: [Ku Derby Avenue RC Basic School na St. George’s Anglican Basic School i Accra, invigilators akiyambulwa akiyakula kwa wazi kwa GH¢60 ya tokeni ya kila siku, wasimamizi waliweka kwenye mikoba yao envelopu za GH¢400, na wanafunzi walitakiwa kuchangia Aseda Offertory. John Kapi alisisitiza kwamba mara WAEC inatoa maoni kuhusu matukio kama hayo, ni wajibu wa Huduma ya Elimu ya Ghana (GES) kuchukua hatua za haraka. Na kwa hivyo wakati masuala haya yanapotokea, mara maoni yanapowapelekea, tuna [WAEC] matarajio kwamba watajibu ipasavyo na kuhakikisha kwamba hatua sahihi inachukuliwa dhidi ya watu hao, alisema.]

text: For rural communities in Ghana, especially in the Kumbungu district, access to and use of maternal healthcare services (MHCS) remain a significant challenge. This study set out to explore the specific barriers preventing women from utilizing these services and to evaluate the quality of care provided. The research adopted a mixed-methods approach, combining both quantitative and qualitative data to get a comprehensive view of the situation. This phased design involved surveying 441 pregnant and postpartum women and conducting interviews with 20 healthcare providers. A facility checklist was also used to assess the state of clinics, including the availability of essential drugs and equipment.
translated: [Kwa jamii za vijijini nchini Ghana, hasa katika wilaya ya Kumbungu, upatikanaji na matumizi ya huduma za afya ya uzazi (MHCS) bado ni changamoto kubwa. Utafiti huu ulianza kuchunguza vikwazo maalum vinavyowazuia wanawake kutumia huduma hizi na kutathmini ubora wa huduma zinazotolewa. Utafiti huu ulitumia mbinu ya mchanganyiko, ikichanganya data ya kiasi na ubora ili kupata mtazamo kamili wa hali hiyo. Muundo huu wa mara kwa mara ulihusisha kuwafanya majaribio 441 wa wanawake wajawazito na baada ya kujifungua na kufanya mahojiano na watoa huduma za afya 20. Orodha ya kituo pia ilitumika kutathmini hali ya klinik, ikijumuisha upatikanaji wa dawa muhimu na vifaa.]

text: Okonkwo was a man of great renown throughout his nine villages and even beyond, a fame built entirely on his own remarkable achievements. At just eighteen years old, he brought honor to his village by defeating Amalinze the Cat, a legendary wrestler who had been undefeated for seven years. Amalinze earned his nickname because his back never once touched the earth. The old men of the village considered Okonkwo's victory one of the fiercest fights they had ever seen.
translated: [Okonkwo alendi muntu wa kulutela kwa kala kwa kala mu vilagesa yandi ya kumi na tatu, na kwa kala kwa kala ku yandi, ngolo yandi yalutelwa kwa kala kwa kala kwa mafundamento yandi ya kala kwa kala. text: Muntaka assured the committee of full logistical and secretariat support from the Ministry and urged them to partner with civil society organizations, development partners, and faith-based institutions in carrying out their work. He described the task as heavy but honorable, stressing that the people of Gbenyiri and surrounding communities were looking up to the committee as instruments of peace, reconciliation, and healing.
translated: [Muntaka akilumbulula komiti ya kusaidia kwa njia ya logístika na sekretariado kutoka kwa Ministério, na kuwaonya kuwa washirikiane na mashirika ya jamii za kiraia, washirika wa maendeleo, na taasisi za kidini katika kufanya kazi yao. Akielezea kazi hiyo kuwa nzuri lakini ya heshima, akisisitiza kwamba watu wa Gbenyiri na jamii zinazozunguka zilikuwa zikiangalia komiti kama zana za amani, upatanisho, na uponyaji.]

text: The study also shed light on significant facility-based challenges that compromise the quality of care. A key issue was the inadequate number of midwives, which likely contributes to the long queues women reported. Additionally, the absence of essential equipment and drugs was a major problem. For example, health service providers specifically recommended a greater number of trained midwives and the provision of critical logistics like ultrasound machines and proper delivery equipment to ensure effective and high-quality care.

text: Okonkwo was an imposing figure, tall and massive with a severe expression, a result of his bushy eyebrows and wide nose. His breathing was so heavy that his family could hear it from their own houses when he slept. When he walked, his heels barely touched the ground, making him seem poised to pounce on someone—which he often did. He had a slight stammer, and in moments of anger, he would resort to his fists when words failed him. He had no patience for men who were not successful, and this sentiment stemmed from his deep-seated shame for his own father.
translated: [Ndoki Okonkwo alingi muntu wa kuluta, wa kipenzi na wa kipenzi wenye uso wa kutisha, uliotokana na mabega yake makubwa na pua pana. Kupumua kwake kulikuwa kwa uzito kiasi kwamba familia yake ilikuwa inaweza kusikia kutoka kwa nyumba zao wenyewe wakati wa kulala. Wakati akienda, viatu vyake havikuwa vikigusa ardhini, na kuifanya ionekane kama vile anasubiri kumpiga mtu—jambo ambalo mara nyingi alifanya. Alikuwa na kikwazo kidogo cha kusema, na katika nyakati za hasira, alitumia mikono yake wakati maneno yalishindwa kumtumikia. Hakuna subira kwa wanaume ambao hawakuwa na mafanikio, na hisia hii ilichukua asili yake kutoka kwa aibu yake ya kina kwa ajili ya baba yake.]

text: The West African Examinations Council (WAEC) says officials implicated in acts of corruption during the Basic Education Certificate Examination (BECE) will be blacklisted from ever taking part in its activities again. Speaking on JoyNews’ PM Express on September 8, WAEC’s Director of Public Affairs, John Kapi, said the Council cannot continue to work with individuals who have betrayed the trust placed in them during national examinations.
translated: [Kimbundu translation: Konselu ya Ekzamini ya Afika ya Lwete (WAEC) yina kuwa ofisialisu ambua yina kuwa na maza ya korupsoni mwa ekzamini ya Sertifikati ya Edukasioni ya Baza (BECE) yina kuwa na lista nyeusi ya kutofanya kazi na Konselu yeno. Kuongelea kwa JoyNews' PM Express mwa Septemba 8, Direktori ya Ekzamini ya Konselu, John Kapi, yina kuwa Konselu yeno yina kuwa na kazi na ofisialisu ambua yina kuwa na maza ya korupsoni mwa ekzamini ya nasionali.]

text: The study found that while a high percentage of women did engage with some maternal health services—87.5% attended antenatal care (ANC), 87.3% had a skilled delivery, and 84.8% had a postnatal care (PNC) visit—the frequency of care was a concern. A little over half of the participants (53.4%) had the recommended four or more ANC visits, and nearly half (46.9%) didn't register until their second trimester. These figures highlight a gap between initial access and consistent, timely utilization of services, suggesting that women may be facing obstacles that prevent them from fully engaging with the healthcare system throughout their pregnancies.
translated: [Estudo descobriu que enquanto uma alta percentagem de mulheres se envolveu com alguns serviços de saúde materna —87,5% frequentaram cuidados pré-natais (CPN), 87,3% tiveram um parto assistido e 84,8% tiveram uma visita de cuidados pós-natais (CPN)— a frequência dos cuidados era uma preocupação. Um pouco mais da metade dos participantes (53,4%) teve as quatro ou mais visitas de CPN recomendadas, e quase metade (46,9%) não se registrou até o segundo trimestre. Estes números destacam uma lacuna entre o acesso inicial e a utilização consistente e oportuna dos serviços, sugerindo que as mulheres podem estar enfrentando obstáculos que as impedem de se envolver plenamente com o sistema de saúde ao longo de suas gravidezes.]

text: The crowd held its breath as the drums beat and the flutes sang. Amalinze was a clever opponent, but Okonkwo was just as skilled, and as slippery as a fish in water. Both men were incredibly strong, their muscles and nerves straining to the point of almost breaking. But in the end, Okonkwo emerged victorious. This monumental win was just the beginning of his legacy. Over the next twenty years, his fame spread like a wildfire, fueled by his unwavering resolve and personal triumphs.
translated: [Ndoki a kala kimbundu kwa kuamba ngoma a kimbala na mbwili a kimbala. Amalinze a kuwanga mukwala, kansi Okonkwo a kuwanga mukwala kwa kala, na a kuwanga kwa kala kwa kimbundu kwa maza. Omba wawu a kuwanga kwa kala kwa kimbundu, kimbundu na kimbundu a kimbala kwa kimbundu kwa kimbundu. Kansi kwa kimbundu, Okonkwo a kimbala kwa kimbundu. text: The seven-member mediation committee will be chaired by Mr. Emmanuel Habuka Bombande. Other members of the committee include Alhaji Collins Dauda (MP and chair of the Committee on Lands and Natural Resource in Parliament), Rev. Father Lazarus Annyere (Chair of Savannah Regional Peace Council), Dr. Festus Aubyn (West Africa Network for Peace-building), Sylvia Hormane Noagbesenu Esq (Ag. Director of Women, Youth, Peace and Security Institute, Kofi Annan International Peacekeeping Training Center), Prof. Ramatu Alhassan and Dr. George Amoh (Ex. Sec. NPC) who will be the secretary.
translated: [Ndalu ya komitê ya kuzinga na kuzinga ya membros saba itakuwa ikiongozwa na Bwana Emmanuel Habuka Bombande. Wanachama wengine wa komitê hii ni Alhaji Collins Dauda (MP na mwenyekiti wa Kamati ya Ardhi na Rasilimali Asilia katika Bunge), Rev. Baba Lazarus Annyere (Mwenyekiti wa Baraza la Amani la Mkoa wa Savannah), Dkt. Festus Aubyn (Mtandao wa Ujenzi wa Amani wa Afrika Magharibi), Sylvia Hormane Noagbesenu Esq (Ag. Mkurugenzi wa Wanawake, Vijana, Amani na Usalama wa Taasisi, Kituo cha Mafunzo ya Ulinzi wa Amani cha Kimataifa cha Kofi Annan), Profesa Ramatu Alhassan na Dkt. George Amoh (Ex. Sec. NPC) ambaye atakuwa katibu.]

text: To improve maternal health in the Kumbungu district, both study participants and service providers offered actionable recommendations. Women suggested focusing on public education about maternal care, enforcing free MHCS, and improving the local road network to make facilities more accessible. Providers emphasized the need for more midwives and better equipment. The study concludes that both governmental and non-governmental organizations must increase investment in maternal health and address the broader socioeconomic issues affecting women. This comprehensive approach, tackling both healthcare system deficiencies and community-level barriers, is essential for truly improving maternal health outcomes.
translated: [Ndanda ya kuzinga kwa mama katika kanda ya Kumbungu, wapiga kura wote na watoa huduma walitoa mapendekezo yanayoweza kutekelezwa. Wanawake walipendekeza kuzingatia elimu ya umma kuhusu huduma za mama, kutekeleza huduma za afya za uzazi bila malipo, na kuboresha mtandao wa barabara za ndani ili kufanya vituo vya afya kuwa rahisi kufikiwa. Watoa huduma walisisitiza hitaji la wakunga zaidi na vifaa bora. Utafiti unahitimisha kwamba mashirika ya serikali na yasiyo ya serikali lazima yawekeze zaidi katika afya ya uzazi na kushughulikia masuala mapana ya kiuchumi na kijamii yanayoathiri wanawake. Mbinu hii ya jumla, inayoshughulikia kizuizi cha mfumo wa huduma za afya na vikwazo vya kiwango cha jamii, ni muhimu kwa kuboresha matokeo ya afya ya uzazi kwa kweli.]

text: Unoka, Okonkwo's father, had passed away ten years prior. He was a man known for his laziness and carelessness, living only for the present with no thought for the future. Any money he managed to acquire—which was a rare occurrence—he would immediately spend on palm-wine, gathering his neighbors for a celebration. He believed that to see a dead man's mouth was to see the foolishness of not eating what you had in life. Unoka was also deeply in debt, owing money to nearly every one of his neighbors.
translated: [N'Unoka, tata wa Okonkwo, alikufa miaka kumi iliyopita. Alikuwa mtu anayejulikana kwa uvivu wake na kutojali, akiishi tu kwa sasa bila kufikiria mustakabali. Fedha yoyote aliyoweza kupata—jambo ambalo halikuwa la kawaida—alitumia mara moja kwa ajili ya pombe ya mchikichi, akikusanya majirani wake kwa ajili ya sherehe. Aliamini kwamba kuona mdomo wa maiti ni kuona ujinga wa kutokula kilicho nacho maishani. N'Unoka pia alikuwa na deni kubwa, akiwa na deni kwa majirani wake wengi.]
